source: MEDES '17: Proceedings of the 9th International Conference on Management of Digital EcoSystems
reason_source_discipline: "Due to the multi-disciplinary nature of digital ecosystems, they are highly complex to study and design. This also leads to a poor understanding as to how managing resources will empower digital ecosystems to be innovative, intelligent and value-creating. The application of Information Technologies has the potential to enable the understanding of how entities request resources and ultimately interact to create benefits and added-values, impacting business practices and knowledge. These technologies can be improved through novel techniques, models and methodologies for fields such as big data management, web technologies, networking, security, human-computer interactions, artificial intelligence, e-services and self-organizing systems to support the establishment of digital ecosystems and manage their resources." https://medes.sigappfr.org/17/

source: ICIET 2020: Proceedings of the 2020 8th International Conference on Information and Education Technology
reason_source_discipline:
"The fields of Information and Education Technology have seen an unprecedented pace of advancement in recent years, playing a transformative role in how knowledge is disseminated and consumed. These technologies have reimagined traditional educational paradigms, leading to more interactive, accessible, and efficient learning environments.

Information Technology, in the context of education, is revolutionizing the way we store, process, and communicate information, making it more accessible and meaningful. Advanced analytics, artificial intelligence, and cloud computing are some of the technological developments that have profoundly impacted the way educational institutions manage and use data, leading to more personalized and effective learning experiences. Education Technology, often termed EdTech, encompasses a broad array of tools, such as digital classrooms, interactive online courses, and AI-driven tutoring systems, all aimed at enhancing the learning process. Over time, these technologies have opened up new learning avenues, improved student engagement, and made education more inclusive. From machine learning algorithms that adapt to students' learning styles to VR applications that provide immersive learning experiences, the opportunities are limitless.

The convergence of Information and Education Technology has a profound impact on the way we perceive and approach education. As a forum dedicated to discussing these transformative changes, 2025 the 13th International Conference on Information and Education Technology (ICIET) will take place in Fukuyama, Japan, from April 18-20, 2025, which is co-sponsored by Fukuyama University, co-hosted by Shonan Institute of Technology. The conference will delve into the latest research findings, emerging trends, and innovative practices in these rapidly evolving fields." https://www.iciet.org/index.html
